meanings.definition: The state or quality of being cold or chilly.
meanings.sent1: The algidity of the ice cream made me shiver.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the algidity of the winter wind on my face.
meanings.sent3: Despite the algidity of the water, the kids still enjoyed swimming in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The algidity of her stare sent a chill down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The algidity of the metal bench numbed my legs within minutes.

meanings.definition: A sensation of coldness or chilliness.
meanings.sent1: The algidity in the room was unbearable without a sweater.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped herself in a blanket to ward off the algidity of the night.
meanings.sent3: The algidity of the popsicle made her teeth chatter with cold.
meanings.sent4: The algidity of his words left her feeling emotionally frozen.
meanings.sent5: The algidity of the snow made the landscape sparkle like diamonds.
